text: I ordered the lunch special #1 for a coworker and myself and we were surprised with how much came with the special. Teriyaki, rice, salad, sushi roll, and soup! The food was delicious too. Definitely recommend this place for lunch!
This is my favorite sushi place in town, really good prices, amazing people and delicious sushi. I recomend it to anybody, I can assure thatvyou will want to come back !!!

The wait staff was very courteous and the food was very fresh. It is kind if a small little place tucked back in the corner of a little strip mall. Their sushi and sashimi is fresh and full of the good stuff.

Went here for lunch. I was only one and service was fast. I ordered garlic tuna sashimi, eel roll, shrimp sashimi. I really like sashimi, but was not fan of eel roll. Overall place is decent for quick lunch. I do think it is little overpriced.

I went to this place today and .... it was disgusting!! the miso soup was good, then I had a sip of my water and it was the most disgusting water I ever had... omg it was NASTY!!!! and the sushi eh had better before ... i just know I'm never going back there again.

Let's start with the basics: the California roll here is hands down the best I've had. After trying various sushi places Nozomi has the best and for a great price. 

Now for the specials, the spicytptp. Deep fried shrimp tempura, crab, jalape√±o, and cream cheese roll. Seriously good. 

Service: I've had a couple different waiters, Justin and Maria. Justin is friend and really into giving you the full experience. Maria was helpful and patient with us. Also very cheerful and took the time to converse with us. I've never gone during rush hour but I think service here is fairly quick. 

Nozomi is definitely worth trying!

I personally think this place is very good and does not get enough attention. When I got there, it was empty except me. Amazing food, good service, and very respectful workers! I do recommend coming here. 5 Stars.

Food was ok.  Sushi was nice but I wouldn't write home about it.  I had a not so good tonkatsu...with cheese.  I really don't think cheese belongs on tonkatsu and the cutlet itself was not very good.  The teriyaki beef was just ok.  Not very tender and the teriyaki sauce was mediocre.    I don't want to give less than a good review to family owned restaurants but only in the hope that they will look to improve for the future.
Cozy and small sushi shop. Lot of great choices and price worth is for all u can eat sushi

I will give Nozomi 4 stars for its proximity when I get those mid-afternoon  spicy tuna urges (which are uncontrollable!) I do enjoy going in here; its small and the service has always been fast for me. Overall, I can't complain. I've been here quite often and have never had any issues. I'm very picky about where I eat sushi but I will proudly say Nozomi wins my approval.

hmmmm. Undecided. On the plus side sweet service and pretty nice, clean, tasty food. Cold tofu was good, and variety of rolls all pretty yummy. We were two of four customers, so ambiance waivered between low to non-existent, which is a shame 'cos I really want tiny, holes-in-the wall that do good food to thrive. Decor is a bit tired, and needs a good clean. Ambivalent about returning, hence the 3 star review.

It is our first time in this place.I love it here! It is a very cute and cozy restaurant!

THE FOOD WAS DELICIOUS.

The staff is very, very friendly. 

I will definetely come back!

The "All You Can Eat" was on point. Delicious and fresh. Our waiter Aaron was super attentive and was on his job. We really enjoyed our time here and the prices a la cart are more than reasonable. Thank you! I'll be back again.

Wow!!! This place is a hiden gem nice cozzy place to drink and enjoy your sushi.
You get to choose between a free small sake or domestic beer with the all you can eat
Of course I got the hot sake.
Food was top NOTCH!!
I had the stupid tuna roll (spicy tuna with cajun albacor and garlic ponzu)

Salsa Tuna (tuna avocado with pico de gallo on top) very delious and fresh.

And being at the medical distric I had to try the 
UMC bake roll (spicy salmon creamcheese spicycrab) and let me tell you it was delicious and creamy.
You guy have to try this place.
Nozomi sushi is located on charleston/rancho on the same shopping center as jimmy johns right infront of omelet house.

Went here for lunch.  Cute place in a strip shopping center.  I ordered off the AYCE menu.  The sushi was delicious and fresh.  Parking can be tough and we had to park on a side street.  I would guess that some people might be using that lot to park for UMC.  Restaurant wasn't too crowded.  Servers were helpful and friendly.  The service was a little bit slow, so I'll have to allow for that next time I go for my sushi lunch.  Highly recommend.

If you're looking for something other than UMC's cafeteria I would highly recommend this spot! They've been in the neighborhood for 2 months so please stop in and welcome sushi chef Joey and crew to the neighborhood! I usually stay away from raw sushi but I will try it to see if I'll be back and I had their Zesty salmon roll which was sooo fresh you couldn't notice it was raw! So yes I will definitely be back! I can't wait to come back and try their salmon ass, Monica and Rock and Rhonda!
This place is really reasonable when it comes to their prices. Their food and service are thumbs up. Very clean restaurant and fresh foods. Surely will come back to this place.

We hit this place in an area not known for Sushi. It is right near the UNLV School of Dentistry and the University Hospital on Charleston. I have to say this little hidden gem didn't disappoint. I found it on Yelp of course.. and it was great. Miso was tasty, the rolls we ordered were great. I had a couple of the spicy variants which were not really spicy but good anyhow. I would repeat. In the area it is the best i have had for sure.

I went to this restaurant last night for the first time..the food was awesome!!!!! I was doing all you can eat sushi..it was okay...chef and server was okay...fish was freshier than i thought.  I ordered just two rolls...sweet lobster and tiger ...i liked it

This place is under new management , been going here for years then stopped as I was no longer a fan . Now however new lovely people and all you can eat for 17.95 what a deal.
Tuna sushi is outstanding and so are the shrimp poppers, stuffed mushrooms and everything else. I have have tried many AYCE all over town and this is one of my favorite . Enjoy.

Been back ones a week since posting , everything is outstanding,glad to have it in the neighborhood , delicious.
pretty good. They don't have an AYCE option so it can get pricy if you have a big appetite. Fish was fresh and there's a variety of rolls, nigiri, and sashimi available.

The Las Vegas Strip is known for fancy gourmet sushi places with flashing lights and loud music. We were in the mood for a quiet, traditional Japanese meal. We found that at Nozomi. It is a small unassuming place located in an obscure strip mall. I had the shrimp and vegetable tempura, which was light, crispy, and flavorful. Nothing spectacular, just simple and satisfying. The sushi was also good. Sometimes I am in an adventurous mood, somtimes not. Nozomi is great for those times when you want to stick with the familiar.

"Dirty Dinning Alert"

A few co-workers and I came here on lunch. The prices where very good the server was nice. But all three of us got food poisoning. This could just be our experience but the aftermath was awful. I don't think I will be trying my luck here again. 

I found out they where on dirty dinning after I wrote this review up top. I would give them a 0 star since they don't care about peoples health.
Five stars for flavor and presentation. Japanese chef makes this a wonderful meal. Here's a place I want to return to much sooner than I will be able !

Would have been a five star, but food was really slow coming out. When my meal finally came was 8th out of 11 meals we all had different things but all in all food was delicious.  The chicken Katsu texture was more like chicken tenders, but was very good

Great place for lunch little slow on the service side but the food is consistent quality and very good. Crunch roll and the mackerel were my favorite the seaweed salad is good too but you can't mess that one up. The box meals are pretty standard. 
The sashimi is good quality and good size portions the best was the salmon hand roll

I love divey sushi bars, the more hole-in-the-wall, the better. I love discovering that they also have amazing sushi at good prices. I wanted so much to fall in love with this place. And yet, that didn't happen.

The Good:
The interior is surprisingly traditional, clean, and inviting. The staff is friendly, the fish is fresh. They were willing to make me a take-out order just before closing, and were quite polite. Crab is real crab, not imitation krab mix, which was a nice change of pace and unexpected given my assumptions about the location.

The Not-So-Good:
Located in a run-down plaza anchored (if you can even say that) by Jimmy Johns and little else, exterior is not at all inviting. Menu features about an equal division of traditional rolls, about a third baked/fried, and variations of the California roll. Found sushi menu fairly boring and (again, based on my expectations given the exterior) overpriced. Majority of rolls other than simple maki-style were over $10, and they were small. 

Ordered a California roll and a Rimba roll (scallop, crab, cream cheese)- rolls were very similar, given that they both had crab. Scallop was minimal, but crab was fresh and genuine. But I didn't expect to spend $16 (including tip) on just crab, and such small portions at that.

After placing my order, noticed DS#5 (dinner special #5) in the regular menu, that looked like a much better value: two pieces each tuna, yellowtail, and salmon nigiri, plus a California roll, and soup, for $16. Sounded like a better deal but felt it was too late to change my order, especially being that they were at closing time. 

Highly suggest they move to another location, and either lower their prices or up their roll sizes. Keep friendly staff and clean, traditional d√©cor scheme. Also consider increasing hours- they are closed Sunday and only open til 9PM other days, which is fairly early. No business at 8:30 on a Friday night, not sure how they turn a profit. Then again, maybe that's why the prices are so high.
Excellent prices and great sushi, 21.95 for all you can eat. At dinner, Cannot beat it! Also rolls by themselves are very reasonably priced, 7.95  - 8.95 for special rolls

Nozomi is piece of shit hole in the wall restaurant. First and last visit to this shitty ass joint. I asked if I can at the bar for all you can eat and staff said NO because bar is reserved for a la carte customers funny thing is it was only my wife and I at the restaurant. I ordered Coca Cola for my beverage and they give you can fuckin soda which means no free refill. When we order we have to mark what we want on a paper menu and only allowed to order I think about 5 items at a time. Waitress took fuckin forever to get to us. I noticed the cook would squat crouch down behind the sushi bar and spend time on his phone. I made sure that character was wearing gloves when he makes my food. Mothefucker also has long hair and didn't not wear a hat so don't be surprise if there's strand of hair on your food. The food was fuckin disgusting. I'm an avid sushi eater I can tell ya that their fish is old as dirt. Paper thin slices of fish on top of brick of rice. I tried the tempura ice cream and how it was served was a shell of tempura drizzles with chocolate syrup and melted fuckin ice cream inside, fuckin horrible. I'm warning about this place, save your time and money and don't come to shithole.
No teepee teepee! Rolls have no flavor and they hustle you to buy full rolls because they won't serve half rolls even tough they are on the menu. Slow service.

This little place was excellent. The sushi was fresh and the rolls were unique. My son had yakisoba and what he didn't eat, my husband finished. It was a bit pricey for the area (hence the four stars). I will return.

We've been going here for years, even though I'm not crazy about sushi. My companion loves it and she's always thought it was great.  They had a management change about a year ago, and expanded the non-sushi items so now I enjoy coming here as much as she does!  The staff is really friendly, especially the waitress (named Sunny, I think?). It says it's not wheelchair accessible but I've never had a problem and I've been in a wheelchair for 9 years. It's not easy to find (which is probably why we like it so much) but well worth the effort.

Support the independantly owned restaurants. Great little spot in the medical district. Great yourself to some good sushi and great customer service. Great for a quick bite or dinner with the family. 


???????????

Went to Nozomi's last night.  I have two other japanese restaurants that I'm loyal to but I had a coupon and figured I'd give it a try.  I'm certainly glad I did.  I will now have to say I have three japanese restaurants that I am loyal to.  Its a small place that has three different shades of wood on the floor and walls.  Sounds weird but it works.  It felt warm and inviting.  My husband ordered tempura udon soup as usual and said it was great.  I had japanese lasagna roll - excellent.  My husband ordered a special shrimp roll that was listed on the board by the sushi bar as a special.  It too was good.  My only complaint would be that the prices were not listed on the specials board.  I always hate to have to ask.  We were waited on by a lovely girl named Rose who took good care of us.  Check it out!
Blech. Was in desperate need for light asian food and quick service for lunch. Got neither. Low grade japanese food summarizes it all.

I stumbled on this place - the sushi was fresh and well prepared- I paid $32 for lunch delicious BUT it was 107 outside and they had no air conditioning!! I loved the food but I sweated profusely for one full hour ! While paying $32 for lunch !!! I asked the staff to tell the owner and they said "he knows about it and won't spend the money for a/c" I noticed sweat trickling down his/her neck and face while this person was talking it was truly UNACCEPTABLE!!! I won't be back because the owner is too greedy to make lots of money and doesn't care about providing a decent atmosphere for his exorbitant prices on the menu.

I absolutely love this place! Not only is the food delicious, but the staff here is so friendly. Favorite rolls are their special Spicy Tp Tp roll and their Alaskan. Great atmosphere, as well. A must try. You will become a regular before you know it.
Liquor license has been appproved. Come enjoy all you can eat sushi and get a small hot sake or domestic beer on the house.

Oh, dear. This is the first time I've had to revise a review from five stars to one star. Nozomi has new owners and the result is catastrophic. First and foremost, the quality of food has suffered immensely. The delicious miso soup is now brown sludge. The sushi falls apart before you can get it to your mouth. The enthusiastic lunch crowd is gone because the menu has been condensed to five or six specials, and, as the rude waitress informed us, "No substitutions allowed! OK?!" Well, no. Not OK. We've come to expect a certain level of customer service from this neighborhood restaurant, and it pains me to know that it will soon fail. Several of the people I work with used to frequent this place. I checked in with them after today's horrible experience and learned that they, too, were very unhappy with the recent changes. It's a shame because I loved this place. I studied in Japan during college and Nozomi used to have the most affordable, authentic food just down the street from my workplace. I'll be looking for another Japanese restaurant and hope that the previous owners are enjoying their well-earned retirement.

We love the service and food at Nozomi's. The sushi is always good!  Our favs are the rockin Rhonda and the lobster roll!   We bring our kids and they are very patient.  Our kids love the teriyaki chicken dinners...lots of food for a good price!

Best ayce prices ever! Their dinner is the usual prices of most of lunch ayve. And their lunch ayce is so cheap for such good fresh fish! I love the sushi there, great atmosphere as well. The ceilings are really cool l. They play kpop as well if you're into that. The service is great as well. They got by ordering through a card which is great for big parties.

If I can give this restaurant a lower rating I would.
I have been coming here for years and the food was always good.  Recently, they had management change and with that change from ala carte to AYCE, which was great.  However, the new management....is awful.  After a few disappointing visits, today was the last straw.  Due to an inspection, the entire restaurant production was halted.  I don't believe this is the policy.  So we waited over 45 min.  Finally, we just had it.  
Beware, if you want to have a quick lunch don't patron.  If you have 3 hours for lunch, you can give it a try.
Really gross sushi, bad rice and low quality fish. Wouldn't recommend to anyone who doesn't like things covered in sauce, I mean COVERED.

Love this place, close to work and pretty tasty sushi.  Service is usually quick and on point.  I cant say too much about this place other than during the day for lunch, never been in the evening.  

The teriyaki chicken and sushi roll lunch is a great, light meal in a quick hurry!! 

Domo arigato!!!!  :)

Very good sushi, calm environment, great service. Only downside is the house salad only had lettuce although it states it has cucumber, tomato, and avocado. I'm sure the salad issue would have been rectified, but I usually do take out here.
Its a nice little place not that busy when I went in. Food is good fair price and great people.
The service and food at Nozomi is top notch! My waitress Sarah was attentive and friendly but not in a creepy way. The best time to go is on Thursday evenings!
Great place to go, good sushi, it is my kids favorite place!  We are regulars and you always know what you're going to get...good sushi and friendly service.

Nice, clean, and quite. Nothing real special tho, rolls were your average run of the mill and cost was a little higher than you would expect from a hole in the wall sushi place. Place was def decent and will work if you need a quick fix but far from being great.

Very expensive for what they offer and the quality. The Asian waitress hesitated when asked if they had all you can eat to then told us that it was everyone or no one if we wanted all you can eat. Go at your own risk.

This place is awesome!  Super nice staff, huge portions, cozy venue makes u feel at home.  Several TVs with sports and music videos but not at all bothersome. Reasonable prices.  Convenient parking. This was my 2nd time here it's near my house.  Will certainly return. Highly recommend!

This is a great little sushi restaurant i have been frequenting lately. Very mellow vibe, and great attentive staff. They are usually playing music videos on the two TV's, either KPOP (which I think is awesome) or American music. Sunny the server is very sweet, and the sushi rolls out pretty quickly after ordering. Everything I've had here is delicious and I very much enjoy having a sushi restaurant close to my house. The sushi is nicely prepared, and they also have a few original rolls. They serve both hot and cold sake, as well as beer, so this makes for fun date nights, or double date nights. I have also seen a few families here as well with young children. This restaurant is very close to UMC hospital so I would imagine it would be a good lunch break option as well. I gave 5 stars for atmosphere, customer service, taste of food, speed of service, and cleanliness or restaurant. Go to Nozomi!!!

I wanted Sushi close to home last night and I found it.  Nozomi is really quaint on the inside, don't let the dive strip mall location scare you.  Their fish is super fresh.  We ate sashimi and quite a few rolls and everything was great!  A Yelper raved about their spicy tuna and it really is one of the best I've had.

The food and service has been amazing! It's such a beautiful establishment and it's not too far from the strip! Food is fresh and delicious and the service is awesome! Definitely giving this place 5 stars!!

I never expected to find such a treasure in an odd part of town, but I found another entryway into Japan on Charleston Blvd and Rancho here in Las Vegas. What was amazing to me was this small restaurant is nestled between a poker lounge and a dental office, and it's called Nozomi. As my manager explained when telling me about this little place, it's one of those eateries you wouldn't normally step in to because of the location and fear of food poisoning. However, I am estatic to say that profile of this place is dead wrong.

They have the menu posted on their entrance, which is typical of any Japanese restaurant where I come from, and their decor is so simple and very Japan that I was right at home when I walked in. The seating arrangement is casual; sit where you like, whether it be the small sushi counter in the corner or one of the many tables, it's up to you. The menus are under the glass on the tables, so you can order from it as you go during the evening. I have to say that I was happy to see a steak dish on the Japanese menu, and different ways to order tempura and sushi.

The one thing that is off putting to me in the states is this constant use of avocado in every sushi rull imaginable. When ordering the tempura roll (finally, a place that has a shrimp tempura roll!), there were chunks of avocado in it. I was at first apprehensive to taste it, but it turned out to be quite good. Their yellowtail and tuna are just as great, and served up Japanese style. The one test I have for any Japanese restaurant is their tempura--and they surpassed my test.

Their tempura is one of the best in Las Vegas, and as good as the Genji Japanese restaurant in the Hilton on Guam. The cuisine from Guam is impeccable, including Japanese food, and the tempura was authentic and fried up by old Japanese men straight from Japan. When trying to find good tempura in Vegas, I look for the signs of a good Japanese place--Japanese owners, and Japanese people eating in that restaurant. I found both here.

We did wait long for the tempura, but when it was received we realized that they were waiting for the oil to heat up to get it perfect. We ordered tempura three times that evening, and were quite satisfied. I have to say that the batter is light and crispy, no hints of grease when delivered, and displayed on a square plate with the oil paper underneath and great tempura sauce on the side. It was light, crispy, and satisfying.

Overall, this restaurant is worth the trip to East Charleston Blvd. Please give it a try--it's worth a shot!
meh. . . okay food.  .  a little on the expensive side.  . .nothing to rave about.  . .

This sushi restaurant is pretty good for a quick lunch.
It can be a hit or miss though. Some days its great and others not so great. However, the service is always good and they are always willing to adjust the menu to your liking.

I was visiting the area and decided to have sushi for lunch. This place came up as in of the "near perfect" establishments in the close by area. I have to admit that the sushi was good. I had one roll and a poki salad. The roll was called kiss. It is salmon and avo topped spicy tuna roll. The poki was the tuna poki. 

The roll was so skimpy! But the price wasn't. This lunch cost me $26.95. I didn't even have a drink. The roll barely had any avo. The salmon was very thin. Also I could literally count the tiny squares of tuna in my poki. I mean really guys. There was maybe 1 oz of fish in my salad and maybe less than that on my roll and for $27 I feel ripped off. 

My review is not only based on the food. The food was good but not worthy of the price. The portion was perfect for lunch but the price was def a dinner price. Not worth it. I paid $27 for dinner at a different sushi place last night and split 4 rolls and edamame with my friend. I would have gone there for lunch cuz I love that place but this was closer.

Poor excuse for Japanese food. Enough said. Small hole in the wall that was very low quality. I would not recommend coming here at all, anyone with good taste in sushi or seafood would be very disappointed.
Nice little hole in the wall... Not many places let you order the good rolls for all you can eat.  And you can order half rolls to share.
Great sushi restaurant! Have been coming here for years! Tucked in the strip mall across from the Omelet House.

My first time in this place with my fellow coworkers & sushi was their goal tonight. We heard about it from another coworker so we thought we would try it.

Please know that I don't like seafood but I do love Japanese cuisine - I'm part Japanese myself & decided to go along. I personally was actually craving some tempura and Gyoza.

When you walk in this little place, the decor alone will take you to what you would imagine what a small family owned place in the native Japan might resemble.

It was all you can eat sushi but my mind was on a mission for my favorites, and as an amazing surprise, they had many other offerings which includes they two items I was craving, plus more!

The waitress was wearing more than one hat, she was also the cook while her partner made the sushi rolls.

One thing I liked was, the restroom was located in the back near the kitchen, when I went to wash my hands, I passed by her and said, "I feel like part of the family going through the kitchen!" I jokingly offered to help with the dishes and she laughed graciously.

The meal came out in a timely fashion. I ordered Chicken Katsu, Gyoza, & Vegetable Tempura.

I was impressed with the plating of the food. Like a work of art, everything looked glamorously delicious, but once we started eating, you just wanted to continue.

The atmosphere was calm and quiet, patrons already there were just as intimately engaged in their own personal conversations as our group was.



Because of its laid back ambiance, we stayed longer than expected and checked out.

I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a quaint dining experience that offers a great selection of Japanese food and friendly atmosphere.

Arigato Go Zai Mas :)

i love there bento teriyaki chicken . oh ! and there lobster rolls are pretty good too ... too bad there in a tiny location but well worth the effort to be there for lunch time because there have fast service everytime

Stumbled upon Nozomi while looking for a pharmacy that was in the strip mall behind it.

If you blink, you'll miss it. 

What a gem!  It wasn't crowded, but the decor makes you feel as if you're in Japan.  We ordered the shrimp tempura, the tonkatsu and croquette dish and the udon with shrimp tempura.

Wow, EVERYTHING was delicious!  From the dressing on the salad (I could have just had a big bowl of the salad with that magical dressing!) to the udon and broth, everything was so tasty.  Even the green tea was ono!

They bring the side order of shrimp tempura for the udon in a cute little "basket".

If you can find it, try it out!

My mom and I came here for lunch because we ended up being way too early for her doctors appointment, and she felt like having sushi. This is the closest sushi place to the Medical District, so there ya go.

I would have never came here otherwise. It's tucked into the corner of a ratty-looking strip mall, across from the Omelet House. I don't think I would have ever noticed it just driving by.

So you walk inside, and the decor is sort of a let down. A little dusty, very dark brown, kinda retro. Nothing has been updated since 1983 (it looks like). To get to the bathroom, you have to walk through the kitchen... Hard to find, and a little awkward. 
After taking a look at the menu, I found the prices of food quite high, considering the look and vibe of the place. But I thought, "hey, maybe it's like one of those hidden gems. Doesn't look like much, but the food will be amazing!"

Womp, womp, woooommmmp.

I found the "lunch" section of the menu, and was excited because the WHOLE ENTIRE POINT of a "lunch menu" is to draw in customers during a typically slow time of the day with cheaper-priced meals. 

I don't think this place got the memo. Most of the decent lunch specials, like the Beef Teriyaki and Sushi Lunch were like, $13-$14 bucks! Are you for real? Sorry, but that's not really.... Um, ya know.... A deal. The cheapest one was the Chicken Teriyaki lunch meal, and that was $9. But to get "all white meat," you had to pay around $1.25 extra. What the heck is that about? Are we at KFC? Weird. The menu said it included gyoza, and a choice of a California Roll or a spicy tuna. It also comes with soup and a salad. 

My mom wanted a california roll, but I got it along with mine, so I told her to order a salmon roll, and I would give her my california roll. Ok, works out great, right?

Hmmph. We get our soup first. It is the worst miso soup I have ever had, sort of like the crappy kind you buy and make yourself at home. I think it was really old or something. Next came the salmon roll, which they brought out first. Why would you bring one person's food out at a different time than the others? First rule of, oh, I don't know, any restaurant ever, is that all guests orders should come out at the same time, so one person doesn't have to just sit there and watch the other eat. 

So I ate most of that, because I was going to give my mom the california roll that was coming with my order. They bring my meal about 10 minutes after they dropped my mom's, and I wanted to punch something. 

My meal was served in one of those "bento" style plastic trays with the different compartments to it. The teriyaki looked good, but upon tasting it, the sauce was boring. So was the salad. It was literally iceberg lettuce pieces, with a mayo-based dressing. That's it. No carrot, no cucumber slices.... Just lettuce. Then the "gyoza" was just that... ONE gyoza. I was hoping I would at least get two or three. And btw, it was the tiniest gyoza I had ever seen in my entire life. 

Then I look over, face filled with redeeming hope, at the california roll.... Four of the most itty-bitty rolls you have ever seen, and they looked like the kind you buy at the Smith's grocery store. Much smaller than the salmon roll, and that wasn't even very big to begin with. 

Total, the meal came to a little over $20. My Perrier added an extra $4 to the meal alone. Trust me when I say, avoid this place at all costs.

This place has been open for about 30 years so they must be doing something right. I come here often for lunch. The sushi chef and owner, Jeff, is very nice and makes great rolls with fresh fish and doesn't overload them with rice. 

My favorite rolls to get here are the rainbow and caterpillar rolls. I also love the chirashi bowl and intend to try the unagi don next time I visit.

Seeing the reviews we had high hopes for this restaurant, but to our dismay, it has left us disappointed.

The location wasn't very nice. The restaurant was at a corner and the sign wasn't big enough to be seen. There were okay parking but this review is just about to get worse.

We decided to go with their all you can eat option--which at first seemed like a good deal. You can order nigiri, sashimi, sushi rolls, specialty rolls, appetizers and so much more for about $21 to $22 for dinner. 

BUT the sushi rice was cooked with so much water that you can't see the individual rice grains, and it was so mushy and chewy that it was hard to swallow. It's almost like it was just regular white rice that was used. The fish on the rolls were alright but they drenched the rolls in whatever sauce they used with it. We got the salmon lover which came with ponzu sauce--drowning in it. We got the red dragon roll--swimming in eel sauce. And when we ordered the shrimp tempura and gyoza appetizers, which were supposedly 3 pieces per order, but we were only given 2 pieces. I got mochi ice cream and was only given one piece cut in half...

I asked for 2 orders of salmon sashimi and only got 3 pieces of salmon. For the all you can eat, 1 person can only have 2 orders of sashimi (3 piece per order) so i wanted 6 pieces not 3. The cut of the sashimi was also off. My boyfriend used to work for a sushi place and everything was just wrong. 

The server did not come back to us regularly to ask if we want to order more either. It seems like they were purposely doing so for us to get feel that we're full.

My total was $52 including the tip. It was not worth it. I wish I took pictures of the food to show how bad it was and how the sushi was falling apart but I was just too disappointed at the time I didn't even think about it.

I went to this restaurant with my family. I'm talking like, 20 people and they were somehow able to accommodate us easily. That is already a big plus, especially since the restaurant isn't that big. 

I wasn't really expecting much from a sushi joint in the desert, but the fish was decent and the portions were generous. I ate a little bit of every dish they had, because everyone got something different. Their tempura was well made, and their teriyaki dishes were good. I ordered a Japanese dinner that came with miso soup, salad, pickled vegetables, sashimi, rice, and chicken teriyaki. I ate it in like 10 minutes and it was very filling. 

I definitely recommend coming here if you're in need of some traditional Japanese restaurant options. It looks sketchy from the outside because of the location but once you're inside you forget where you are except at a nice place for a meal.

I like this place for the lunch specials.  I tend to the get the teriyaki chicken, beef and rice combo.  Starts with the miso soup and the lunch includes salad, rice and a California  roll. I've ordered their specialty rolls and they were good but I think the pricing on those is a little high.  Service is good but get here early because it's very small and fills up quickly for lunch.

I stumbled across this restaurant while looking for a dinner spot before taking a friend to Frankie's Tiki Bar.  If you've been to Frankie's before you know it's a good idea to have a filling meal before or you'll be leaving Frankie's with your underwear on your head but I digress...

I arrived before my friend and found the dining room to be attractive and clean.  The waitress quickly took my drink order and  brought it out with a bowl of miso soup.  She asked me if I wanted to order and I told her I was waiting for my friend who was running late.  It all went downhill from there. 

My friend arrived and we had to wait 10 minutes for the waitress to take her drink order and another 10 for her to bring out her water.  She did not bring her out a bowl of miso so I felt uncomfortable eating mine in front of her.  We had to flag her down to ask if there AYCE available.  No where on the menu did it say how much it was and I ended up having to go on their website to find out how much it was (thank you iphone!).  This was while the waitress was having a long conversation with some other customers.  We decided against the AYCE and were finally able to get the waitress's attention long enough to  order a Rainbow roll, a Spider Roll, and a Shrimp Lover's special.  

I was relieved that the fish was fresh, the rolls were large, and everything was delicious.  However, we had to ask the waitress for wasabi and I ended up having to swipe chopsticks from another table.

The food was delicious; it's too bad the service was so bad.  I don't think I'll be back unless I'm pre-gaming and need some rice to soak up delicious rum drinks.

I come here often. I actually prefer this place compared to a lot of "popular" sushi places. It's quiet and the staff is very kind. This along with the consistency of food keeps me coming. The quality of seafood is superb and actually surprised me considering the area of town. It's a very simple Japanese atmosphere, wood walls, a few Japanese dolls as decor. I appreciate the simplicity. Over all, the food and staff are exceptional and I'll keep going.

The staff are VERY nice and the restaurant is precisely what I want a Japanese sushi house to look like. It's a tiny little place tucked into a small strip mall off off Rancho and you truly wouldn't expect to find such a gem there. The food was fresh and flavorful. The sushi chef works out in the dining room on full display, you can watch him prepare your meal from any seat in the house. 

A $1 or penny sake night would definitely amp our desire to put this restaurant into a weekly rotation. :)
Fantastic spot! All you can eat at a decent price in a nice central location. Good service! Very cute spot.

I love this place for fresh sushi and yummy special rolls. Great price for lunch 17. 95 for all u can eat sushi. It deserves a lot you will surprise. I am coming often when I crave sushi. Best price in town.
This place is great! The sushi is amazing and it is reasonably priced. I will definitely coming back with my friends and family! 5 stars all the way
Fresh fish, beautifully cut. I thought it was delicious! They were incredibly busy but still service was very timely. The quality seemed very good for the price.
The sushi is good, service is great, and overall a generally good place to have dinner.

A little hole in the wall place just outside the strip. Pleasantly surprised. Food was great. Husband had the tempera and it was made perfectly lightly coated and flaky - not like some places where they add too much batter. I had various sushi. I'm allergic to soy and wheat so they gave me sesame oil and seracha  chili for dipping - yum!

I have patronized Nozomi for a number of years for lunch and dinner and like to have dinner here before going to the Smith Center for a show or the Philharmonic.  It's a quiet, little, out-of-the-way restaurant with good food and reasonable prices; however, I probably won't be returning any time soon.  

If you're cold-blooded by nature, this may be a comfortable restaurant to dine at but, for the rest of us, the temperature of the dining room is way too high.  When customers are drinking hot tea and hot miso soup and it's 88 degrees outside, you CANNOT keep the thermostat in the dining room set between 82-85!!  I've mentioned to the sushi chef and waitress several times when I've been there that the dining area seemed uncomfortably warm.  They'll turn down the thermostat and it will cool off, but every time I return, it's the same thing.  The final straw was when I paid the bill and left the restaurant sweating.  They clearly don't understand that the comfort of the diners comes first.  I'll have to find another restaurant to go to from now on before I go to the Smith Center, which is disappointing.
This place is a nice little gem! Great prices and good quality food. Very unexpected which was actually awesome. Will be back for sure!

I liked the cozy atmosphere and friendly servers. My wife and I loved the fried California roll and shrimp tempura. Our dining partners did care for the yakisoba or chicken teriyaki. I took a bit of the chicken and found it tough and chewy. So, go for the sushi.

The service was great, very friendly staff.  They would deserve more stars.  However the food is just not good.  It looks like Korean restaurant trying to be Japanese.  Nothing against Korean food.  It's just not the same as Japanese food.

This place converted me from a sushi hater to a sushi lover. I have always hated sushi, but when the lunch special that I ordered came with 4 pieces of California roll, I figured I might as well give it a try. It was delicious and so was the rest of the food. It is also reasonably priced. I will absolutely be coming back here on a regular basis.
So authentic! Friendly staff, quick service, variety of beers! Nice selection of rolls!

Nozomi is a hole in the wall Japanese restaurant and sushi bar located in the same shopping center as the Omelet House on Charleston just East of Rancho. I have been going to this spot for as long as I can remember, and it may have even been the first place I ever had sushi. It also may have been one of the first sushi restaurants in Las Vegas, however, back then it was run by sushi chef Roy and was called Kifune. The interior hasn't changed much in 22 years, so it's a comforting place to eat for me. In my visits to Nozomi I have found the sushi to generally be very good, sometimes excellent, and sometimes not so good. One time we went there and they had the cooler at the sushi bar set at too low a temperature so the fish began to freeze, which caused the cell walls to break and destroyed the texture. The horror! Anyhow, that only happened once and every other time I've been pretty happy with my overall experience.

After sampling many different items on the menu I have settled on a favorite, and that is the Chuckster Salad ($14). This salad is unique from anything I've had elsewhere, and because a lot of care has gone into the selection of the individual components the end result is a success. The first time I ordered it I thought, "Wow, what a clever way to use the extra pieces of fish you can't use for sushi or sashimi," but after watching them prepare it I saw that this was not an economical way to use leftovers, but rather a special dish in and of itself. The salad starts with chunks of freshly cut fish, including yellowtail, salmon, and tuna. I'll agree that these are your garden variety species that you can get anywhere, but they are certainly fresh here and their growing popularity makes this salad pallet pleasing to even the novice sushi eater. To these hearty bite-sized pieces the chef adds shredded daikon radish, sweet pickled cucumbers, and tempura "crunchies," all of which add perfect counter textures to the fish. That's pretty much all there is to it, with the exception of a delicious creamy dressing and garnish of daikon radish sprouts. If you are looking for a low carb alternative to your ordinary rolls, this is the perfect choice.

On this visit, we also tried something new that we will definitely order again, the Shrimp Wraps ($9).  These reminded me of the Japanese version of Koong Sarong at Lotus of Siam. Instead of bacon, however, these have a filling of cream cheese. They are also wrapped in wonton wrappers rather than egg roll wrappers, and are served with a sweet hot wasabi sauce rather than sweet chili sauce. The dish is executed well and even though it is simple, the flavors go together wonderfully. Between the Chuckster Salad and the Shrimp Wraps we were satiated and pleased. Even more pleasing was that both items totaled $23, not bad for dinner. I won't make the claim that Nozomi is the best sushi restaurant in town, but it is a charming place and these dishes are both worth going for.

I have tried some of the more popular sushi locations in Vegas in search of the best tastes.  I've had Yama, Kaya, Jjanga, Umiya, and a few other. But, none of these places have kept me coming back for more as often as I do with Nozomi. This is definitely on of the most underrated sushi bars I have ran into. I've also brought my friends and co workers to Nozomi and they all fell in love with it as much as I did. You must try this place! I give this place a 10 out of 5!!!!!

Great Bento box lunches. $8.95 chicken teriyaki...Add $1 for all white meat chicken so $9.95. Substituted vegetable tempura for the California roll. Miso soup,  Salad very fresh. Crispy pot sticker. Good rice. Lots of tender chicken breast. Boyd had salmon teriyaki $10.95 with the California roll...excellent!! Side order of veggie sushi.(avocado, pickled radish & pickled carrots) very good. Sunny, our server, was so friendly, we can't wait to go back!
Amazing place for a good price! The sushi/sashimi tasted great. Generous portions of food and quick service! Highly recommend it

I was very surprised to find that this place has been here for about 30 years. It is located in the strip mall off of Charleston and Rancho. The dining area was very clean and nicely decorated. The waitress was extremely friendly, and was able to suggest items on the menu. I tried the teriyaki chicken lunch special. The food was very good, and there was a large portion for the price. It came with the teriyaki chicken, sticky rice, a potsticker, a small salad, and four California rolls. That's a lot of food for lunch! The teriyaki chicken had a very nice smoky grilled flavor, with a sweet sticky sauce. I also tried the green tea ice cream which was a nice small portion for dessert.
Awesome vegetarian sushi!!! I hesitate to go to sushi places with friends since I don't eat seafood any longer but NOZOMI really satisfied the veggie lover in me!

This place is under new owners... we didn't know that when we went but decided to stay and try it out anyways... we are so glad we did... this place has amazing SUSHI!!! The prices are even great... I would recommend this place to everyone

What a joke.  I decided to check out this all you can eat sushi for quick lunch nearby my work.  I so regret coming here.  The waitress (looks like she could be the owner) was so rude, I was ordering, going down the sushi list, when I was about to order my 9th sushi item and she interrupted me and stated there are other customers that need the food and rudely walked away.  I didn't even get to order my miso soup.  It was pretty shocking but I patiently waited for the orders that I was able to squeeze it despite her reluctance to take my full order.  I was hoping that the food would make up for the horrible service.  However it was just as horrifying.  The rice was so undercooked, it felt like I was eating hard plastic beads.  The fish was so unfresh, it looked like it was left out in the open for awhile all dehydrated.  I was so afraid I might get food poisoned.  The presentation was horrible too with chunks of seaweed paper here and there randomly, fish unevenly cut with left over piece dangling on the side, wasabi all dried up looked like it got picked up in the hot desert sun.  Unbelievable.  No wander they have to lie to the public by saying its there "Grand Opening" when it's been around for years.  I will never eat here ever again.

I love love love this place! Its been a minute since ive been here...i used to come when i was pregnant with my son..it was my craving for shrimp tempura....

There was a young lady Rose who used to work there but she had a baby too and now Sunny has stepped in to continue the AMAZING CUSTOMER SERVICE!

I have not once...(knock on wood)..had a bad experience...hence my 5 stars...(i dont give those very often)

The sushi chef has been here for years and he was still here tonight...his food has always been consistent and on point!

Only ok - I ate here for lunch the other day and it just wasn't all that impressive. 

I got the beef teriyaki lunch special that came with miso soup, a salad, one fried dumpling, rice, and 4 pieces of a California roll. The dressing was new to me (creamy rather than the ginger dressing you normally see) and maybe my favorite part of the meal - though they almost put too much dressing on. The beef teriyaki was ok, but not served very hot, and the California roll was about what I'd expect. 

I may find myself back here if I'm in the area, but at $12.95 it was a bit more than I'd want to pay for a lunch special and the quality of the food.

Hearty portions the first time around brings us back again...

There's something different about the menu...they got rid of their three combo special!  Bummer! 

For $12.95, I got the chicken and beef teriyaki that came with tempura and a four-piece CA roll.  The lunch came with one piece of shrimp tempura and three pieces of veggies, the beef and chicken, rice, pickled daikon, a side salad with creamy dressing and miso soup.  The beef and chicken were okay, heavy on the teriyaki sauce.  The tempura was just alright as well.  But the CA roll was pretty disappointing. I never order it, but it's been a long time since I've actually seen the kani sitting there in one piece.  (Nowadays they usually chop it up and mix it a little so it looks and tastes a lot better.)  

For $14.95, the Big F got the two combo lunch with chicken Katsu and fried scallops.  It also came with miso soup, pickled daikon, side salad, rice, and sunomono.  He remembered the fried scallops from before, which is why he ordered them again.  He was less than impressed this time around with his entire lunch.

There was only one official waitress working and maybe the lunch crowd filled up more this time.  But she was running around a lot and it wasn't until we were almost done did someone from the back come out and help her clean up the dirty tables.  

Overall, our experience the first time was much better. The food just wasn't up to par.  We definitely wouldn't eat here again, especially without a coupon!   It's a pretty average Japanese restaurant.  And with how their CA roll was, I'm not too excited to try their sushi.

2.5 stars.
The prices were so cheap I was afraid that it wasn't gonna be that great, but it was really good and better than a lot of places that charge way more. I will go back and I definitely recommend.
Had lunch with a client. One server and the ayce was minimal. Good food, extremely slow service, and I will not return....

I really WANTED to like this place! But unfortunately it just wasn't possible given our experience here... :(

EXTERIOR: 1.5 (strip mall)

INTERIOR: 4

FOOD TASTE: 5

FOOD PRICE: 2.5

FOOD QUANTITY: 2

SERVICE: -1

... So the two best things going for this restaurant are definitelty the cool looking interior (which isn't *that* amazing, but I still like it a lot) and the taste of the food which I must say is quite good...

A big downside is the prices being high for less than desirable amounts of food.

Obviously the things I was least a fan of was the service. Our waitress didn't seem to care about how pleasant our experience was. She basically ignored requests we made and even overcharged us by a little.

Conclusion? Despite the yummy spice tuna roll and teriyaki salmon, I'll skip this place next time.
Very good service with great food! We stopped here for all you can eat lunch special and it was very fulfilling! Recommend getting the Eel
Decent rolls but Crappy area. They should do something with the interior decor. Clean up the joint a bit that would make a big difference.

Highly disappointed in this place. First off, it took forever to get service at the sushi bar (I was one of two people at the sushi bar for lunch with maybe 2 small groups at tables.)  Next, the pricing is very high for a lunch sushi place and the sushi choices are small and "vanilla".  Yes there are some special rolls but they don't seem all that cutting edge.

Still, I was hungry and the sushi looked fresh so I ordered a lunch bento.  The soup was actually good but the salad was boring and drenched with a thick white globby dressing.

The bento came with 2 salmon, 2 tuna, 2 yellowtail and a spicy tuna roll.  The spicy tuna was anything but spicy.  The rest of the sushi was very tiny cuts of sushi on a very small rice block.  The salmon was the best, well marbled and flavorful.  The yellow tail was bland.  

The sushi bar is small and there was a wierd heat coming from the sushi bar.
No return trip planned in the future.

This used to be a consistent lunch spot for me and then I took a break from coming so often. I finally decided to go back today and  I don't know what has happened but it isn't good.

The menu has totally changed and perhaps ownership too. I did manage to find my standard lunch that I always order though but just not the same. I ordered the Chicken Teriyaki bento box. This used to be a really healthy and tasty lunch but not anymore. The chicken was over cooked,
dry and barely had any teriyaki sauce on it. The tempura was also a bit on the "done" side and the veggies were hard like it they been sitting for a while. The salad dressing has also changed and it used to be so yummy! The restaurant has recently been updated and it is a little bigger than it used to be. 

Why fix it if it is not broken?? I rarely give a two star review but I was so surprised at how much this restaurants has gone the wrong direction. It used to be packed all the time, especially at lunch but today there were only a couple tables that had people dining. 

I will always remember and long for the old Nozomi's...

My hubby and I are Japanese food lovers, coming to Vegas from Phoenix for our anniversary. We went here for  lunch and OMG, the food is so AMAZING! Highly recommend the eel lover, spicy salmon roll, and soft shell crab! Friendly and welcoming atmosphere and reasonable price too! We will definitively come back if we stop by Vegas next time.

SLOWEST SUSHI PLACE I'VE EVER BEEN TO. Seriously. 

Granted, I came here with a fairly large group (10+ ppl), but the restaurant only had 2 other tables, and most of us ordered the chicken teriyaki lunch combo.  It took us so long to get drinks, order, and pay, I considered leaving multiple times during my meal. To top it off, the one person who ordered the sashimi salad got her food last! Like, that is the ONE DISH that did not require any cooking!!! And it came out like 10 mins after all the bento boxes (and each bento box came out as if the cook in the back was preparing each one at a time...)

Food was mediocre at best, and not great for the price.  The only reason it gets 2 stars instead of 1 star is because it's walking distance from UMC and because the food was clean and I did not get sick...

If I spent more time in LV, I could see this being my 'lovable' neighborhood Japanese go-to.  Excellent overall selection and menu.  The sushi was good (but not better), and the rolls were the main draw.  If you like saucy and creative and tasty rolls, you'll like their spread.  The non-sushi items we ordered were fine as well- namely a chicken katsu which my daughter devoured. Soups and salads were nice as well.  I'll surely return when in LV.

Really good food!  Really quick and friendly service!  The waitress was extremely nice and helpful over the phone with my inquiries and the attitude carried over into the restaurant - the chef and waitress always had a smile!  The food was great - generous portions but also great quality!  Nigiri was not too thin/thick, rice quality was great, and the appetizers were a good size - everything from fried oysters down to the mackerel nigiri was delicious!  This is definitely one of my spots on this side of town!
